title: HOUR 1 - Too Many Players Are Considered for Pro Football Hall of Fame
itunes:title: HOUR 1 - Too Many Players Are Considered for Pro Football Hall of Fame
description:
In this hour of The Herd with Colin Cowherd, Colin sees it every year--people arguing over who should be in a particular hall of fame. But according to Colin, there are too many current players being discussed for the Pro Football Hall of Fame. He argues the true list of active players bound for Canton is much shorter. Also, Colin finds himself pulling for Michigan to beat Georgia before the Wolverines and Bulldogs square off in the College Football Playoff semifinal. Why? There's a stark difference in existential perspective between programs in the SEC and the Big Ten: patience. Finally, Albert Breer of TheMMQB.com stops in to chat about the future of several NFL quarterbacks.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
